title: struct containing array of size given in Self and slice causes compiler panic

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-associated-items
labels.description: Area: Associated items such as associated types and consts.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
A struct containing an array and a reference to a slice causes the compiler to panic if the array size is defined in the impl block.
The issue also occurs for smaller array sizes.

- Size in impl (panics): https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2018&gist=68c21606e452c40f2330402a9f4768e6
- Moving SIZE out of the impl resolves this: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2018&gist=5b65fe2fcbc33b4436cbbfcc168276c7
- The same happens in constructors:
    - https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2018&gist=bc4ac0526a12e0fc8f6585c5ddf91369
    - https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=release&edition=2018&gist=32bcf1323d6484eeeba7d840a5730766

```Rust
pub struct Memory<'rom> {
    rom: &'rom [u8],
    ram: [u8; Self::SIZE],
}

impl<'rom> Memory<'rom> {
    pub const SIZE: usize = 0x8000;
}
```
